</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The increase in dividends over the last three fiscal years is the result of regular increases in our dividend payout rates. We paid dividends of $1.10, $1.04 and $0.96 per share in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Capital Expenditures
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We expect capital expenditures for fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to be in the $17.0&#160;million to $19.0 million range, primarily consisting of capital associated with additional information technology equipment and infrastructure investments. Depreciation for fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is expected to be in the range of $16.0&#160;million to $17.0&#160;million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	ERP Project
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In fiscal 2011 Applied commenced its ERP (SAP) project to transform the Company's technology platforms
<BR>
	and enhance its business information and technology systems for future growth. We have deployed our solution in our Western Canadian operating locations and our traditional U.S. Service Center Based Distribution businesses, excluding recent acquisitions. In fiscal 2014, the Company initiated the conversion to SAP of its related financial and accounting systems, including the receivables, payables, treasury, inventory, fixed assets, general ledger and consolidation systems. All of these underlying financial and accounting systems, except for the consolidation process/system, were transitioned to SAP during fiscal 2015. At the beginning of fiscal 2016 the Company converted to a new consolidation process and system. During the third quarter of fiscal 2016, the Company determined that operations in Eastern Canada will be transitioned onto SAP throughout fiscal 2017 and 2018. The Company will continue to evaluate and consider an appropriate deployment schedule for other operations not on SAP.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Share Repurchases
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Board of Directors has authorized the repurchase of shares of the Company&#8217;s stock. These purchases may
<BR>
	be made in open market and negotiated transactions, from time to time, depending upon market conditions.
<BR>
	At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had authorization to purchase an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	296,200
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we repurchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	951,100
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, 1,740,100 and 759,900 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock, respectively, at an average price per share of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$39.39
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, $43.97, and $48.34, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Borrowing Arrangements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In December 2015, the Company entered into a new five-year credit facility with a group of banks expiring in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December 2020
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. This agreement provides for a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$125.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;unsecured term loan and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$250.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;unsecured revolving credit facility. Fees on this facility range from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.09%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.175%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per year based upon the Company's leverage ratio at each quarter end. Borrowings under this agreement carry variable interest rates tied to either LIBOR or prime at the Company&#8217;s discretion. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$123.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;outstanding under the term loan and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$33.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;outstanding under the revolver. Unused lines under this facility, net of outstanding letters of credit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to secure certain insurance obligations, totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$214.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and are available to fund future acquisitions or other capital and operating requirements. The interest rate on the term loan as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The weighted-average interest rate on the revolving credit facility outstanding as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.44%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The new credit facility replaced the Company's previous term loan and revolving credit facility agreements. The Company had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$96.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;outstanding at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;under the previous term loan agreement, which carried a variable interest rate tied to LIBOR and was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.19%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$52.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;outstanding under the previous revolving credit facility. Unused lines under this facility, net of outstanding letters of credit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to secure certain insurance obligations, totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$94.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and were available to fund future acquisitions or other capital and operating requirements. The weighted-average interest rate on the revolving credit facility outstanding as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Additionally, the Company had letters of credit outstanding with a separate bank, not associated with the revolving credit agreement, in the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, in order to secure certain insurance obligations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In April 2014 the Company assumed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of debt as a part of the acquisition of our headquarters facility. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;fixed interest rate note is held by the State of Ohio Development Services Agency and matures in May 2024. We had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;outstanding under this note at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company had borrowings outstanding under its unsecured shelf facility agreement with Prudential Investment Management of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$170.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The "Series C" notes have a principal amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$120.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and carry a fixed interest rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.19%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	; the principal is due in equal payments in July 2020, 2021, and 2022. The "Series D" notes have a principal amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$50.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and carry a fixed interest rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.21%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	; the principal
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	21
</FONT>

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage25"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#AIT-2016630X10K_HTM_S673B78E593AF86E9FF8184D3AB0C0324">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	is due in equal payments in October 2019 and 2023. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$50.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in additional financing was available under this facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The revolving credit facility and unsecured shelf facility contain restrictive covenants regarding liquidity, net worth, financial ratios, and other covenants. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the most restrictive of these covenants required that the Company have net indebtedness less than 3.25 times consolidated income before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company's indebtedness was less than two times consolidated income before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization. The Company was in compliance with all covenants at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Accounts receivable are reported at net realizable value and consist of trade receivables from customers. Management monitors accounts receivable by reviewing Days Sales Outstanding (DSO) and the aging of receivables for each of the Company's locations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On a consolidated basis, DSO was 49.4 at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;versus 50.0 at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Accounts receivable decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	7.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;this year, compared to an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decrease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in sales in the twelve months ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Acquisitions added $8.0 million, or 2.1%, of accounts receivable in fiscal 2016. We primarily attribute the decrease in DSO to the improved timing of collections within our traditional U.S. Service Center Based Distribution businesses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Approximately 2.7% of our accounts receivable balances are more than 90 days past due at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;compared to 4.2% at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. This improvement relates to our U.S. Service Center Based Distribution businesses. On an overall basis, our provision for losses from uncollected receivables represents 0.17% of our sales in the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Historically, this percentage is around 0.10% to 0.15%. The increase in the provision as a percentage of sales for fiscal 2016 relates to $2.4 million of expense for reserves added in the twelve months ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for our operations focused on upstream oil and gas customers due to the recent downturn in the energy markets. Management believes the overall receivables aging and provision for losses on uncollected receivables are at reasonable levels, and that past due balances will continue to decline in fiscal 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Inventory Analysis
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Inventories are valued at the average cost method, using the last-in, first-out (LIFO) method for U.S. inventories and the average cost method for foreign inventories. Management uses an inventory turnover ratio to monitor and evaluate inventory. Management calculates this ratio on an annual as well as a quarterly basis and uses inventory valued at average costs. The annualized inventory turnover (using average costs) for the period ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;&#32;&#32;
<BR>
	was 3.6 versus 3.7 at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. By actively managing our inventory levels, we were able to maintain our inventory turnover in a period of declining sales. We believe our inventory turnover ratio in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;will be slightly better than our fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;levels.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	22
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(1) Amounts represent estimated contractual interest payments on outstanding long-term debt obligations. Rates in effect as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;are used for variable rate debt.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Purchase orders for inventory and other goods and services are not included in our estimates as we are unable to aggregate the amount of such purchase orders that represent enforceable and legally binding agreements specifying all significant terms. The previous table includes the gross liability for unrecognized income tax benefits including interest and penalties in the &#8220;Other&#8221; column as the Company is unable to make a reasonable estimate regarding the timing of cash settlements, if any, with the respective taxing authorities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have evaluated events and transactions occurring subsequent to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;through the date the financial statements were issued.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	CRITICAL ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The preparation of financial statements and related disclosures in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make judgments, assumptions and estimates at a specific point in time that affect the amounts reported in the consolidated financial statements and disclosed in the accompanying notes. The Business and Accounting Policies note to the consolidated financial statements describes the significant accounting policies and methods used in preparation of the consolidated financial statements. Estimates are used for, but not limited to, determining the net carrying value of trade accounts receivable, inventories, recording self-insurance liabilities and other accrued liabilities. Estimates are also used in establishing opening balances in relation to purchase accounting. Actual results could differ from these estimates. The following critical accounting policies are impacted significantly by judgments, assumptions and estimates used in the preparation of the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	LIFO Inventory Valuation and Methodology
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Inventories are valued at the average cost method, using the last-in, first-out (LIFO) method for U.S. inventories, and the average cost method for foreign inventories. We adopted the link chain dollar value LIFO method for accounting for U.S. inventories in fiscal 1974. Approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	22.8%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our domestic inventory dollars relate to LIFO layers added in the 1970s. The excess of average cost over LIFO cost is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$147.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as reflected in our consolidated balance sheet at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Company maintains five LIFO pools based on the following product groupings: bearings, power transmission products, rubber products, fluid power products and other products.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	LIFO layers and/or liquidations are determined consistently year-to-year. See the Inventories note to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
<BR>
	consolidated financial statements in Item 8 under the caption "Financial Statements and Supplementary Data,
<BR>
	for further information.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Allowances for Slow-Moving and Obsolete Inventories
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We evaluate the recoverability of our slow-moving or obsolete inventories at least quarterly. We estimate the recoverable cost of such inventory by product type while considering factors such as its age, historic and current demand trends, the physical condition of the inventory, as well as assumptions regarding future demand. Our ability to recover our cost for slow moving or obsolete inventory can be affected by such factors as general market conditions, future customer demand and relationships with suppliers. A significant portion of the products we hold
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	23
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#AIT-2016630X10K_HTM_S673B78E593AF86E9FF8184D3AB0C0324">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in inventory have long shelf lives, are not highly susceptible to obsolescence and are eligible for return under various supplier return programs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company's reserve for slow-moving or obsolete inventories was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$25.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$17.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, recorded in inventories in the consolidated balance sheets. The increase is due to $3.6 million added to the reserve related to closing locations for restructuring activities within the Service Center Based Distribution segment along with with additional reserves for slow-moving inventory due to lower sales levels.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Allowances for Doubtful Accounts
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We evaluate the collectibility of trade accounts receivable based on a combination of factors. Initially, we estimate an allowance for doubtful accounts as a percentage of net sales based on historical bad debt experience. This initial estimate is adjusted based on recent trends of certain customers and industries estimated to be a greater credit risk, trends within the entire customer pool and changes in the overall aging of accounts receivable. While we have a large customer base that is geographically dispersed, a general economic downturn in any of the industry segments in which we operate could result in higher than expected defaults, and therefore, the need to revise estimates for bad debts. Accounts are written off against the allowance when it becomes evident that collection will not occur.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of June 30, 2016 and 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;our allowance for doubtful accounts was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of gross receivables, respectively. Our provision for losses on accounts receivable was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and $4.0&#160;million in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Goodwill and Intangibles
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Goodwill is recognized as the amount by which the cost of an acquired entity exceeds the net amount assigned to assets acquired and liabilities assumed. Goodwill for acquired businesses is accounted for using the acquisition method of accounting which requires that the assets acquired and liabilities assumed be recorded at the date of the acquisition at their respective estimated fair values. The judgments made in determining the estimated fair value assigned to each class of assets acquired, as well as the estimated life of each asset, can materially impact the net income of the periods subsequent to the acquisition through depreciation and amortization, and in certain instances through impairment charges, if the asset becomes impaired in the future. As part of acquisition accounting, we also recognize acquired identifiable intangible assets such as customer relationships, vendor relationships, trade names, and non-competition agreements apart from goodwill. Finite-lived identifiable intangibles are evaluated for impairment when changes in conditions indicate carrying value may not be recoverable.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We evaluate goodwill for impairment at the reporting unit level annually as of January 1, and whenever an event occurs or circumstances change that would indicate that it is more likely than not that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying amount. Events or circumstances that may result in an impairment review include changes in macroeconomic conditions, industry and market considerations, cost factors, overall financial performance, other relevant entity-specific events, specific events affecting the reporting unit or sustained decrease in share price. Each year, the Company may elect to perform a qualitative assessment to determine whether it is more likely than not that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying value. If impairment is indicated in the qualitative assessment, or, if management elects to initially perform a quantitative assessment of goodwill, the impairment test uses a two-step approach. Step one compares the fair value of a reporting unit with its carrying amount, including goodwill. If the fair value of the reporting unit exceeds its carrying amount, goodwill of the reporting unit is not impaired, and the second step of goodwill impairment test is unnecessary. If the carrying amount of a reporting unit exceeds its fair value, the second step of the goodwill impairment test is performed to measure the amount of impairment loss (if any). Step two compares the implied fair value of the reporting unit goodwill with the carrying amount of goodwill. The implied fair value of goodwill is determined in the same manner as the amount of goodwill recognized in a business combination, meaning, the reporting unit's fair value is allocated to all the assets and liabilities of the reporting unit (including unrecognized intangible assets) as if the reporting unit had been acquired in a business combination and the fair value of the reporting unit is the price paid to acquire the reporting unit. If the carrying amount of a reporting unit's goodwill exceeds the implied fair value of its goodwill, an impairment loss is recognized in an amount equal to the excess.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Goodwill on our consolidated financial statements relates to both the Service Center Based Distribution segment and the Fluid Power Businesses segment. The Company has seven (7) reporting units for which an annual goodwill impairment assessment was performed as of January 1, 2016.&#160; The Company concluded that five (5) of the reporting units&#8217; fair value substantially exceeded their carrying amounts. The carrying value for two (2) reporting units (Canada service center and Australia/New Zealand service center) exceeded the fair value, indicating there may be goodwill impairment.&#160; The fair values of the reporting units in accordance with step one of the goodwill impairment test were determined using the Income and Market approaches. The Income approach employs the discounted cash
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	24
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage28"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#AIT-2016630X10K_HTM_S673B78E593AF86E9FF8184D3AB0C0324">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	flow method reflecting projected cash flows expected to be generated by market participants and then adjusted for time value of money factors. The Market approach utilized an analysis of comparable publicly traded companies.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Step two of the goodwill impairment test for the Canada service center reporting unit was completed in the third quarter of fiscal 2016.&#160; The analysis resulted in a goodwill impairment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$56.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the Canada service center reporting unit.&#160; The non-cash impairment charge was the result of the overall decline in the industrial economy in Canada coupled with the substantial and sustained decline in the oil and gas sector during calendar year 2015.&#160; This led to reduced spending by customers and reduced revenue expectations.&#160; The uncertainty regarding the oil and gas industries and overall industrial economy in Canada also led the reporting unit to reduce expectations.&#160; The remaining goodwill for the Canada service center reporting unit at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$31.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Step two of the goodwill impairment test for the Australia/New Zealand reporting unit was completed in the third quarter of fiscal 2016.&#160; The analysis concluded that all of the Australia/New Zealand reporting unit&#8217;s goodwill was impaired, and therefore the Company recorded a non-cash impairment expense of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$8.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in the third quarter of fiscal 2016.&#160; The impairment charge was primarily the result of the decline in the mining and extraction industries in Australia, reduced spending by customers, and the effects of reduced revenue expectations.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The techniques used in the Company's impairment test have incorporated a number of assumptions that the Company believes to be reasonable and to reflect known market conditions at the measurement date. Assumptions in estimating future cash flows are subject to a degree of judgment. The Company makes all efforts to forecast future cash flows as accurately as possible with the information available at the measurement date.&#160; The Company evaluates the appropriateness of its assumptions and overall forecasts by comparing projected results of upcoming years with actual results of preceding years.&#160; Key Level 3 based assumptions relate to pricing trends, inventory costs, customer demand, and revenue growth.&#160; A number of benchmarks from independent industry and other economic publications were also used.&#160; Changes in future results, assumptions, and estimates after the measurement date may lead to an outcome where additional impairment charges would be required in future periods.&#160; Specifically, actual results may vary from the Company&#8217;s forecasts and such variations may be material and unfavorable, thereby triggering the need for future impairment tests where the conclusions may differ in reflection of prevailing market conditions.&#160; Further, continued adverse market conditions could result in the recognition of additional impairment if the Company determines that the fair values of its reporting units have fallen below their carrying values.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Self-Insurance Liabilities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We maintain business insurance programs with significant self-insured retention covering workers&#8217; compensation, business, automobile, general product liability and other claims. We accrue estimated losses using actuarial calculations, models and assumptions based on historical loss experience. We also maintain a partially self-insured health benefits plan, which provides medical benefits to U.S. based employees electing coverage. We maintain a reserve for all unpaid medical claims including those incurred but not reported based on historical experience and other assumptions. Although management believes that the estimated liabilities for self-insurance are adequate, the estimates described above may not be indicative of current and future losses. In addition, the actuarial calculations used to estimate self-insurance liabilities are based on numerous assumptions, some of which are subjective. Self -insurance liabilities totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$8.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, and were recorded in compensation and related benefits and other current liabilities in the consolidated balance sheets. We will continue to adjust our estimated liabilities for self-insurance, as deemed necessary, in the event that future loss experience differs from historical loss patterns
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Deferred income taxes are recorded for estimated future tax effects of differences between the bases of assets and liabilities for financial reporting and income tax purposes, giving consideration to enacted tax laws. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company had recognized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of net deferred tax assets. Valuation allowances are provided against deferred tax assets where it is considered more-likely-than-not that the Company will not realize the benefit of such assets. The remaining net deferred tax asset is the amount management believes is more-likely-than-not of being realized. The realization of these deferred tax assets can be impacted by changes to tax laws, statutory rates and future taxable income levels.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Income taxes on undistributed earnings of non-U.S. subsidiaries are not accrued for the portion of such earnings that management considers to be permanently reinvested. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, management considered all undistributed earnings of non-U.S. subsidiaries to be permanently reinvested. Undistributed earnings of non-U.S. subsidiaries totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$141.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for which no provision for U.S. income tax had been made.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	25
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	CAUTIONARY STATEMENT UNDER PRIVATE SECURITIES LITIGATION REFORM ACT
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	This Form 10-K, including Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis, contains statements that are forward-looking based on management&#8217;s current expectations about the future. Forward-looking statements are often identified by qualifiers, such as &#8220;guidance&#8221;, &#8220;expect&#8221;, &#8220;believe&#8221;, &#8220;plan&#8221;, &#8220;intend&#8221;, &#8220;will&#8221;, &#8220;should&#8221;, &#8220;could&#8221;, &#8220;would&#8221;, &#8220;anticipate&#8221;, &#8220;estimate&#8221;, &#8220;forecast&#8221;, &#8220;may&#8221;, "optimistic" and derivative or similar words or expressions. Similarly, descriptions of objectives, strategies, plans, or goals are also forward-looking statements. These statements may discuss, among other things, expected growth, future sales, future cash flows, future capital expenditures, future performance, and the anticipation and expectations of the Company and its management as to future occurrences and trends. The Company intends that the forward-looking statements be subject to the safe harbors established in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 and by the Securities and Exchange Commission in its rules, regulations and releases.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Readers are cautioned not to place undue reliance on any forward-looking statements. All forward-looking statements are based on current expectations regarding important risk factors, many of which are outside the Company&#8217;s control. Accordingly, actual results may differ materially from those expressed in the forward-looking statements, and the making of those statements should not be regarded as a representation by the Company or any other person that the results expressed in the statements will be achieved. In addition, the Company assumes no obligation publicly to update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether because of new information or events, or otherwise, except as may be required by law.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Important risk factors include, but are not limited to, the following: risks relating to the operations levels of our customers and the economic factors that affect them; changes in the prices for products and services relative to the cost of providing them; reduction in supplier inventory purchase incentives; loss of key supplier authorizations, lack of product availability, or changes in supplier distribution programs; the cost of products and energy and other operating costs; changes in customer preferences for products and services of the nature and brands sold by us; changes in customer procurement policies and practices; competitive pressures; our reliance on information systems; the impact of economic conditions on the collectability of trade receivables; reduced demand for our products in targeted markets due to reasons including consolidation in customer industries; our ability to retain and attract qualified sales and customer service personnel and other skilled executives, managers and professionals; our ability to identify and complete acquisitions, integrate them effectively, and realize their anticipated benefits; the variability, timing and nature of new business opportunities including acquisitions, alliances, customer relationships, and supplier authorizations; the incurrence of debt and contingent liabilities in connection with acquisitions; our ability to access capital markets as needed on reasonable terms; disruption of operations at our headquarters or distribution centers; risks and uncertainties associated with our foreign operations, including volatile economic conditions, political instability, cultural and legal differences, and currency exchange fluctuations; the potential for goodwill and intangible asset impairment; changes in accounting policies and practices; our ability to maintain effective internal control over financial reporting; organizational changes within the Company; the volatility of our stock price and the resulting impact on our consolidated financial statements; risks related to legal proceedings to which we are a party; adverse regulation and legislation, both enacted and under consideration, including with respect to federal tax policy (e.g., affecting the use of the LIFO inventory accounting method and the taxation of foreign-sourced income); and the occurrence of extraordinary events (including prolonged labor disputes, power outages,telecommunication outages, terrorist acts, earthquakes, extreme weather events, other natural disasters, fires, floods, and accidents). Other factors and unanticipated events could also adversely affect our business, financial condition or results of operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We discuss certain of these matters and other risk factors more fully throughout our Form 10-K, as well as other of our filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#AIT-2016630X10K_HTM_S673B78E593AF86E9FF8184D3AB0C0324">

<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ITEM 7A.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our market risk is impacted by changes in foreign currency exchange rates as well as changes in interest rates.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
<BR>
	We occasionally utilize derivative instruments as part of our overall financial risk management policy, but do not use derivative instruments for speculative or trading purposes. We do not currently have any outstanding derivative instruments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Foreign Currency Exchange Rate Risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Because we operate throughout North America, Australia and New Zealand and approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	16.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our fiscal year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;net sales were generated outside the United States, foreign currency exchange rates can impact our financial position, results of operations and competitive position. The financial statements of foreign subsidiaries are translated into their U.S. dollar equivalents at end-of-period exchange rates for assets and liabilities, while income and expenses are translated at average monthly exchange rates. Translation gains and losses are components of other comprehensive income (loss)&#160;as reported in the statements of consolidated comprehensive income. Transaction gains and losses arising from fluctuations in currency exchange rates on transactions denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are recognized in the statements of consolidated income as a component of other expense (income), net. Applied does not currently hedge the net investments in our foreign operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During the course of the fiscal year, the Canadian, Australian, and Mexican currency exchange rates decreased in relation to the U.S. dollar by 5.0%, 3.1%, and 15.6%, respectively, and the New Zealand currency exchange rate increased in relation to the U.S. dollar by 3.7%. In the twelve months ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we experienced net foreign currency translation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	losses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which were included in other comprehensive income (loss). We utilize a sensitivity analysis to measure the potential impact on earnings based on a hypothetical 10% change in foreign currency rates. Excluding the non-cash impairment charge recorded in fiscal 2016, a 10% strengthening or weakening of the U.S. dollar relative to foreign currencies that affect the Company from the levels experienced during the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;would not have a material impact on net income for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#76787A;">
	Int
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#929496;">
	erest Rate Risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our primary exposure to interest rate risk results from our outstanding debt obligations with variable interest rates. The levels of fees and interest charged on our various debt facilities are based upon leverage levels and market interest rates.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our variable interest rate debt facilities outstanding include our five-year credit facility, which provides for a revolving credit facility with a capacity of up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$250.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in borrowings and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$33.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;outstanding at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$125.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;term loan, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$123.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was outstanding at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	June&#160;30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Fixed interest rate debt facilities include
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$170.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;outstanding under our unsecured shelf facility agreement, as well as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of assumed debt from the purchase of our headquarters facility. We had total average variable interest rate bank borrowings of $195.4 million during fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The impact of a hypothetical 1.0% increase in the interest rates on our average variable interest rate bank borrowings would have resulted in a $2.0 million increase in interest expense. Changes in market interest rates would also impact interest rates on these facilities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We monitor depository institutions that hold our cash and cash equivalents, primarily for safety of principal and secondarily for maximizing yield on those funds. We diversify our cash and cash equivalents among counterparties to minimize exposure to any of these entities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For more information relating to borrowing and interest rates, see the &#8220;Liquidity and Capital Resources&#8221; section of &#8220;Management's Discussion and Analysis
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221; in Item 7 and note 5 to the consolidated financial statements in Item 8. That information is also incorporated here by reference. In addition, see Item 1A, &#8220;Risk Factors,&#8221; for additional risk factors relating to our business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<DIV>

<EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	ITEM 8.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTARY DATA.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A NAME="AIT-2016630X10K_HTM_S7502B8D5368A00B530B284D3AE5E4315">

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:174%;PADDING-BOTTOM:13PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Applied Industrial Technologies, Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 55 ROMAN,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Cleveland, Ohio
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:4PX;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Applied Industrial Technologies, Inc. and subsidiaries (the "Company") as of June 30, 2016 and 2015, and the related statements of consolidated income, comprehensive income, shareholders' equity, and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended June 30, 2016. Our audits also included the financial statement schedule listed in the Index at Item 15. These financial statements and financial statement schedule are the responsibility of the Company's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the financial statements and financial statement schedule based on
<BR>
	our audits.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In our opinion, such consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Company at June 30, 2016 and 2015, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended June 30, 2016, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. Also, in our opinion, such financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic consolidated financial statements taken as a whole, presents fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the Company's internal control over financial reporting as of June 30, 2016, based on the criteria established in "Internal Control-Integrated Framework (2013)" issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission, and our report dated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	August&#160;24, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;expressed an unqualified opinion on the Company's internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	/s/ Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Cleveland, Ohio
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	August&#160;24, 2016
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	28
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#EFEFEF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#AIT-2016630X10K_HTM_S673B78E593AF86E9FF8184D3AB0C0324">
